NEWS BITES

Dubai’s Drop in Luxury Property Prices Offers Best Deals for Investors Dubai is now the third most affordable city for investors purchasing luxury residential properties as prices for prime residential properties there have dropped 20% in the last five years, according to Savills’ World Cities Prime Residential Index. It was also found to be the fourth-best city worldwide for returns on investment for prime residential rental yields. Gulf News

China’s Silicon Valley Slated to Get Its Most Expensive Apartment Developers China Jinmao Holdings Group and Power Construction Corporation of China are seeking approval to charge 100,000 yuan (US$13,982) per square meter for apartments in the 665-unit Longhua Jinmao Palace in Shenzhen. Individual units could be worth 20 million yuan, which would make for the most expensive residential development in Shenzhen’s Longhua district, according to industry insiders. South China Morning Post

Sublime Singer Drops Price on Los Angeles, California, Home to $2.345 Million Rome Ramirez, singer and guitarist for the band Sublime With Rome, dropped the price on his 1920s Laurel Canyon home from $2.495 million to $2.345 million. The 2,548-square-foot hillside home was purchased in 2017 and underwent a big remodeling project while keeping the Monterey Colonial home’s original details. realtor.com

U.S. Home Price Increases Expected for 2020 U.S. home prices are expected to get a 5.4% boost by July 2020 due to low interest rates, according to CoreLogic. In recent months, the growth of home prices has slowed in some major markets like New York, Miami and Seattle as more buyers are priced out of the big markets, but increased income and low mortgage rates are expected to drive price growth up. MarketWatch
